prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Start by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch. On this sketch, create a rectangle by drawing six lines: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.625] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.5, 0.625], End Point [0.25, 0.625] 4. line\\_4: Start Point [0.25, 0.625], End Point [0.25, 0.25] 5. line\\_5: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.25] 6. line\\_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.625, using the sketch\\_scale parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch by applying the coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.75 units, to create a 3D model. Part 2 Create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Set the coordinate system's Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], and Translation Vector to [0.5, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a 2D sketch and draw a triangle by creating three lines: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.25] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.25. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the current coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.5 units. Apply the CutFeatureOperation during the extrusion process, resulting in the removal of the selected half of the material. Part 3 Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom, having the dimensions 0.375 units by 0.5 units by 0.375 units. Set the coordinate system's Euler Angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and Translation Vector to [0.5, 0.25, 0.25]. Create a 2D sketch and draw a triangle by drawing three lines: 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.375], End Point [0.25, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.375] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.375], End Point [0.0, 0.375] Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the current coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch, applying a CutFeatureOperation and setting the extrusion depth towards the opposite normal direction to 0.5 units. This way, you will achieve the desired tapered shape.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[-90.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.625]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.625],"End Point":[0.25,0.625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.625],"End Point":[0.25,0.25]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.25]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.75,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.625,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.5,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.25,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.0],"End Point":[0.25,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.25],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.25,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.5,0.25,0.25]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.375],"End Point":[0.25,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.0],"End Point":[0.25,0.375]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.375],"End Point":[0.0,0.375]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.5,"sketch_scale":0.375,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2736, 0.0] Create the first face with the following loop: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7523, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.7523, 0.0], End Point [0.7523, 0.1368] * Line 3: Start Point [0.7523, 0.1368], End Point [0.2736, 0.1368] * Line 4: Start Point [0.2736, 0.1368], End Point [0.2736, 0.4103] * Line 5: Start Point [0.2736, 0.4103], End Point [0.0, 0.4103] * Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.4103], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Create part 1 by extruding the sketch with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.2736 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.7523 * Operation: Create a new body **Part 2: Cut a rounded top surface from part 1** Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.3339] Create the first face with the following loop: * Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], Mid Point [0.1366, 0.0745], End Point [0.2736, 0.0007] * Line 1: Start Point [0.2736, 0.0007], End Point [0.2736, 0.0764] * Line 2: Start Point [0.2736, 0.0764], End Point [0.0, 0.0764] * Line 3: Start Point [0.0, 0.0764], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Create part 2 by extruding the sketch with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.2736 * Sketch scale: 0.2736 * Operation: Cut from existing body The final shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other, with a rounded top surface and flat bottom surface. The dimensions of the final shape are: * Length: 0.7523 * Width: 0.2736 * Height: 0.7523</description>

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.2736,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.7523,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.7523,0.0],"End Point":[0.7523,0.1368]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.7523,0.1368],"End Point":[0.2736,0.1368]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.2736,0.1368],"End Point":[0.2736,0.4103]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.2736,0.4103],"End Point":[0.0,0.4103]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.4103],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2736,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.7523,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.3339]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"Mid Point":[0.1366,0.0745],"End Point":[0.2736,0.0007]},"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.2736,0.0007],"End Point":[0.2736,0.0764]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.2736,0.0764],"End Point":[0.0,0.0764]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0764],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.2736,"sketch_scale":0.2736,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a flat, rectangular metal plate with two holes on the top side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0129, 0.0 Next, draw the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of three faces, and each face has loops and curves as described below. Face 1 Draw a circle with center at (0.1681, 0.1681) and radius 0.1681 in `loop_1`. Draw another circle with center at (0.1681, 0.1681) and radius 0.0328 in `loop_2`. Face 2 In `loop_1`, draw: - An arc with start point (0.0, 0.1681), mid point (0.1681, 0.0), end point (0.3362, 0.1681) - A line with start point (0.3362, 0.1681) and end point (0.3362, 0.5819) - An arc with start point (0.3362, 0.5819), mid point (0.1681, 0.4138), end point (0.0, 0.5819) - A line with start point (0.0, 0.5819) and end point (0.0, 0.1681) Draw a circle with center at (0.1681, 0.375) and radius 0.0328 in `loop_2`. Face 3 Draw a circle with center at (0.1681, 0.5819) and radius 0.1681 in `loop_1`. Draw a circle with center at (0.1681, 0.5819) and radius 0.0328 in `loop_2`. Apply the scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch using the `sketch_scale` parameter. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.0129 units towards its normal vector, generating the 3D model for the plate. The height, width and length of the intermediate part and the final shape are as follows: - Height: 0.75 - Width: 0.0129 - Length: 0.75</description>
completion:

{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0129,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1681,0.1681],"Radius":0.1681}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1681,0.1681],"Radius":0.0328}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.1681],"Mid Point":[0.1681,0.0],"End Point":[0.3362,0.1681]},"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.3362,0.1681],"End Point":[0.3362,0.5819]},"arc_2":{"Start Point":[0.3362,0.5819],"Mid Point":[0.1681,0.4138],"End Point":[0.0,0.5819]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5819],"End Point":[0.0,0.1681]}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1681,0.375],"Radius":0.0328}}},"face_3":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1681,0.5819],"Radius":0.1681}},"loop_2":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1681,0.5819],"Radius":0.0328}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0129,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

The height of this part is 0.75 units, width is 0.0441 units and length is 0.75 units.</description>

<description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start point (0,0), End point (0.6,0) - Line 2: Start point (0.6,0), End point (0.6,0.75) - Line 3: Start point (0.6,0.75), End point (0,0.75) - Line 4: Start point (0,0.75), End point (0,0) Close the loop to form a face. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: (0,0,0) - Translation Vector: (0,0,0) Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.3 units along the normal direction to create a 3D model. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: (180,0,-90) - Translation Vector: (0.5704,0.75,0.0191) Extrude the 2D sketch by 0 units along the normal direction and by 0.7 units along the opposite direction of the normal. Part 3: Rectangular Prism with Half Height Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: (180,0,-90) - Translation Vector: (0.5424,0.05,0.1697) Draw a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start point (0,0), End point (0.4809,0) - Line 2: Start point (0.4809,0), End point (0.4809,0.0737) - Line 3: Start point (0.4809,0.0737), End point (0,0.0737) - Line 4: Start point (0,0.0737), End point (0,0) Close the loop to form a face. Final CAD Model: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Indents Combine the three intermediate CAD parts to create the final CAD model. The final CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. There are two indents on the prism, one on the top and one on the bottom, each with a length of 0.5408 units and a width of 0.6999 units. The indent on the top is angled at 45 degrees. The indent on the bottom is a rectangular prism with a height of 0.4809 units.</description>
